result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Leon Harris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Cause Injury/Operate-Control. Substance (2+), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(2)(a)3.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $2,819.00 payable to Stephen T.  To be paid first.

Pay all mandatory costs, penalties, surcharges including the $50.00 ignition interlock surcharge.
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:  To be paid through collection of sums by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any remaining balance to convert to civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other time being served.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain/maintain full time emloyment OR if enrolled in school fulltime, part time work.
Obtain mental health assessment-if necessary complete follow up treament, take presdription meds only in the manner as prescribed by treating physician.

No illegal drugs dealing or association with drug community, drug users, dealers, houses.
No  new law violations rising to the level of  probable cause.
No contact with Stephen T.

Cooperate with all rules set forth by the probation agent.
Pay all supervision fees.
Obtain AODA assessment. Complete follow up treatment.  Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.

supervisions.notes: Court Order for IDP Related Offense Driver Asessment and Driver Safety Plan signed and filed.

Provide DNA sample, pay surcharge.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm possession and voting.

Defendant Robert Leon Harris in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Plea/sentencing on today.  Defense requesting an adjournment.  Off the record conference held with the parties.  Conference set forth on the record by the Court. Defense request to allow in-person meeting between the parties and the victim heard and denied.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for March 11, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Court orders defendant REFERRED TO WCS for supervision upon leaving court if they are eligible for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program. ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug test and portable breathalyzers. IF THEY FAIL TO REPORT TO WCS A WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.   No driving without a valid license.
